content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution for your problem using Julia programming language:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyyMM"), df[:dt]) |> Vector{String}
    return df
end
```

This function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym` to it which contains the year and month of each date in the format "yyyymm". The `|> Vector{String}` is used to convert the output from `Dates.format(x, "yyyyMM")` to an array of strings.

You can use this function like:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=Date[2021-01-01, 2022-02-02, 2023-03-03])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` to your DataFrame with values "202101", "202202" and "202303".
